column4: hi all! how do i get the unity plugin visible in compizcontrol settings manager?

apt-get install unity returns: The following packages have unmet dependencies.  unity : Depends: compiz-core-abiversion-20110828     Depends: compiz-plugins-main-default but it is not going to be installed            E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.    synaptic says there's no broken packages and the only locked package is gnome-session
What version of ubuntu do you have?
that's what i was thinking too but E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.
are there packages that conflict with unity that i need to remove?
0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 3 not upgraded.
try running software update and see if it works
ok i guess i have 2 update managers, one of which says i need to install libboost-signals so doing that
apt-get install unity still returns unity : Depends: compiz-core-abiversion-20110828
Depends: compiz-plugins-main-default but it is not going to be installed
E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.
yumbo, Package compiz-core-abiversion-20110828 is a virtual package provided by:
